definition:
There are two main uses of the [*plus sign*]{} “$+$” (which is a
simplified form of “&”) in the mathematics and the applying sciences:

-   The original use is as the sign for the binary operation
    [*addition*]{} of numbers and other elements of rings and algebras,
    vectors, etc.:
    $$a\!+\!b\; := \mbox{\, the sum of\, } a \mbox{\, and\, }b$$

-   There is also a special use for the unary operation [*identity
    mapping*]{} concerning numbers and other ring elements:
    $$+a\; :=\; a \mbox{\; (for all  } a)$$
